com.unvired.chyme.api

Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.unvired.chyme.api.Validator

  • public abstract class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    The Validator class provides the context to validate the input for a parameter in a command Bot.
    It also allows the Bot to set the results of validation to be returned to the user.

    Validator class contains the bot name, parameter name and the value provided for that parameter by the user in the client. If the command bot contains more that one input parameter then it also contain the values for all the parameters that have already been validated before the current parameter being validated. Once the parameter is validated the Bot can respond in one of 3 ways.

    1. Set the validated value using setValidatedValue(String) to indicate that the input was acceptable
    2. Set a message using setMessage(String) to indicate that the input was not acceptable
    3. Set a message and provide a list of alternative possibilities for the parameter using addValidatedValue(String).
      This is used in a scenario when the input though valid is still ambiguous to take a definite action
    Author:
    Unvired Inc

      • isPreProcess

        public boolean isPreProcess()
        Flag that indicates if the call to the validation handler is in the pre-processing stage or in the validation stage. In the pre processing phase Chyme determines the attributes of a parameter to determine if it needs to request the user to input a value
